meanings.definition: Making someone or something less important or powerful.

meanings.definition: Serving to connect a main clause with a subordinate clause.
meanings.sent1: The word 'although' is a subordinative conjunction.
meanings.sent2: Subordinative conjunctions help create complex sentences.
meanings.sent3: Using subordinative words can make your writing more interesting.
meanings.sent4: She used a subordinative conjunction to join the two ideas.
meanings.sent5: Remember to use a subordinative conjunction to link the clauses.

meanings.definition: Acting as a subordinate or lower-ranking member of a group.
meanings.sent1: The subordinative team member always follows the leader's instructions.
